loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad vive en casa apropia con su hijo, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende Productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia. Ella busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda, como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc.  lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Ana, 42, lives in her own home with her son. She has a small store where she sells perishable goods such as soft drinks, candy, and other types of food and non-food products. She has gotten her family ahead through this business. She is seeking to improve her quality of life; for this reason, she is applying for a loan to increase her product variety such as basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and so forth. This will allow her to increase her store's profits and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grains, soft drinks, candy, and so on.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre trabajador y pujante de 31 años de edad, padre de un hijo de 5 años al que ha sacado adelante trabajando arduamente para darle lo mejor.
Durante su vida productiva se dedicó por muchos años a manejar taxi, pero cansado de la misma rutina y de estar expuesto a tantos peligros, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de comidas hace aproximadamente 6 meses, tiene la ventaja de que el local donde está ubicado es propio, trabaja todos los días de 6 a 10 pm y ha tenido muy buena acogida por parte de la comunidad que habita en el sector; así ha logrado generar ingresos de manera independiente y además puede pasar más tiempo con su pequeño hijo.
El crédito lo solicita como un apoyo para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, pues con el dinero comprará una plancha y una freidora, sillas y mesas, esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen de su negocio, además podrá ofrecer comodidad y aumentar su carta para deleitar los diferentes gustos de sus comensales; esto le dará impulso para aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe como ganancias.
Carlos tiene como propósito a mediano plazo, hacer de su negocio un restaurante reconocido en el sector, que le permita garantizar una estabilidad económica para brindar a su hijo una excelente educación y ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hardworking and vigorous man of 31, the father of a 5-year old son whom he has brought up, working arduously to give him the best.

During his productive life, he worked for many years driving a taxi, but tired of the same routine and being exposed to so many dangers, he decided to start his own food business about 6 months ago. It has the advantage that the he owns the place where he works. He works every day, from 6 am to 10 pm and he has had a very good welcome on the part of the community that lives in the area. In this way, he has achieved generating income in an independent manner and, in addition, he can spend more time with his small son.

The loan he is applying for is for support to continue strengthening his business. With the money he will buy a griddle and a fryer, chairs and tables. This will let him improve the image of his business. Additionally, he will be able to offer comfort and increase his menu to delight the different tastes of his diners; this will build momentum to increase his sales and the income that he receives as profit.

As a medium-term goal, Carlos plants to make his business a restaurant known in the area that permits him to guarantee economic stability to provide an excellent education for his son and offer better living conditions and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a griddle and a fryer, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu. She is 29 years old, from Waterloo2, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married, with two children.  

In 2012, Kadiatu established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase bags of coal, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of coal, to expand her business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral pollos, patos y cerdos, en su domicilio luego de engordarlos los ofrece a un mejor precio en el mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para la compra de calamina para arreglo de su techo y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Filomena is 69-years-old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotun. The people in her district work in agriculture, trade, and ranching two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising poultry animals such as chickens, ducks, and pigs. At her residence, she fattens them up and offers them at a better price in the market in the area. She is asking a loan of 1,000 new soles to buy animal feed to fatten her animals and secondly so that she can buy corrugated sheet metal to fix her roof so that she has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and corrugated sheet metal to fix her roof.

loans.name: Sameth's Group

texts.en:
Sameth is 41 years old and has four children, three of whom attend school. She is a local farmer living in Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province.  In addition to rice farming, she works for others for a fee and tailors clothes for additional income. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 15,800 KHR per day and save 4,800 KHR after deducting the necessary expenses. 

Sameth is requesting her third loan from VisionFund. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to upgrade her standard of living.  For this loan, she leads a group of two. She and her co-borrower are requesting 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan to buy potash for her crops. She hopes that her crop will return a good yield so that she can gain double income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Al-Saeedah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Saeedah and it consists of three women, who have been operating different businesses.  They live in Aden, Yemen and are requesting a loan of 210,000 YER. 

Lolah is the leader of group.  She is 44 years old and the mother of six children, who live together in Aden, Yemen. She is enthusiastic about selling clothes, incense and perfumes to her female customers.  She believes that business has been going so well because she is very friendly and is well known. Due to the bad situation in Yemen, her business is currently bringing in less profit. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy additional goods such as ladies' clothing, incense, and perfumes. This will allow her to offer a greater variety to her customers and increase her income, helping her to work toward getting more profit and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional goods such as ladies' clothing, incense, and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru:
Это Шарифа с города Кургантюбе. Она занимается торговлей. Ей 47 лет, она замужем, имеет четверых детей школьного возраста. Три года назад Шарифа вместе с мужем открыли магазин, где они продают продукты питания и хозяйственные товары. Сегодня их торговля идет хорошо и за этот промежуток времени они приобрели своих постоянных клиентов. Шарифа обслуживает каждого своего клиента быстро и качественно. Все довольны ее обслуживанием. 
В данный момент запасы товаров в их магазине заканчиваются и им необходимо привезти новый товар, чтобы не потерять клиентов в этой конкурентной среде. В связи с этим Шарифа запрашивает кредит, чтобы приобрести ассортимент продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Она ждет поддержки.
texts.en: This is Sharifa from the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is a shopkeeper. She is 47 years old, married, and has four school-age children. Three years ago Sharifa and her husband opened a store where they sell groceries and household goods. Today their sales are going well and they've won regular customers during this period of time. Sharifa serves each customer quickly and well. Everyone is satisfied with her service. Currently the store is running out of stock and they need to bring in new goods so that they don't loose customers in a competitive environment. To do this Sharifa is asking for a loan to buy a range of new grocery and household products. She waits for your support.

loans.use: To buy grocery and household items

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора заботливая мать 2 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Она с трудом вырастила своих детей, так как ее муж давно бросил их и женился на другой женщине. Гулнора уже более 11 лет занимается купле продажей детской одежды. Гулнора торгует на местном рынке. Гулнора старается обновить ассортимент своего товара каждый сезон и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Гулнора запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. С полученного дохода она собирается улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnora is the caring mother of two grown children. Raising her children was difficult because her husband left them early on and married another woman. Gulnora has been selling children's clothing at the local market for over 11 years. She tries to renew her inventory with each season and thus attract more customers. She is asking for a 7000 somoni loan for the next season. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your compassion. She plans to use the income earned from use of the loan to improve her standard of living. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира жизнерадостная женщина. Она разведенная и имеет 2 детей. Она сама вырастила с большим трудом своих детей. Замира окончила университет искусства. Она много лет работала в театре как актриса. Данное время она занимается предоставлением услуги ведущей в различных мероприятиях и на свадьбах. Она вместе со своими детьми живет в старом доме. Замира хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zamira is a spirited woman. She is divorced and has two children. She raised them on her own with great difficulty. Zamira graduated from college with an art degree. She worked for many years in the theater as an actress. Currently she is providing master of ceremony services at various functions and weddings. She lives with her children in an aging house. She wants to make repairs to the house, but does not have enough money. She is asking for a 5000 somoni loan to buy building materials including cement and lumber. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood for house repairs

loans.name: Ninfa Del Rocio

texts.es:
Ninfa es una mujer de 45 años de edad, cabeza de hogar desde la separación de su ex esposo y una luchadora incansable que siempre busca lo mejor para ofrecer a sus hijos. Hace más de 13 años se dedica a la confección, oficio que aprendió como una opción para generar ingresos que le permitieran solventar los gastos básicos de su familia. Presta sus servicios a terceros, a los que les confecciona camisas y camisetas de dotación, trabaja todos los días y cuenta con la ventaja de que es reconocida en el mercado, por su amplia trayectoria además lleva 10 años prestando sus servicios a los mismos clientes que confían y conocen sus productos; por lo que tiene trabajo durante todo el año.
Solicita el crédito como apoyo para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones. Entre otros), así tendrá materia prima disponible para cumplir con los pedidos de manera ágil y oportuna para poder adquirir más contratos, lo que beneficiará su economía, al recibir mejores ingresos por cada producción.
Ninfa se proyecta para un futuro a mediano plazo, fortaleciendo y ampliando más su negocio, que tenga una estructura tanto física como financiera más amplia para poder generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y así garantizar una rentabilidad favorable para dar a sus hijos educación universitaria de calidad; pues sueña con verlos convertirse en profesionales íntegros y exitosos.
texts.en:
Ninfa is a 45 year-old woman, head of the household since the separation from her ex-husband and tireless fighter who always looks for the best to offer her children. More than 13 years ago she started working as a seamstress, a job that she learned as an option to generate income that would permit her to cover the basic expenses of her family. She offers her services to third parties, for whom she makes shirts and work shirts. She works every day and has the advantage that she is known in the market because of her extensive experience. In addition, she has been offering her services to the same clients for 10 years who trust and know her products; therefore, she has work all year.

She is applying for the loan as support to buy supplies in bulk (fabric, thread, buttons, among others). Therefore, she will have prime materials available to fulfill the orders in an agile and opportune manner to be able to acquire more contracts. This will benefit her economy, upon receiving more income for each production.

Ninfa pushes herself for a medium-term future, strengthening and growing her business, so that it may have a greater fiscal and financial structure to be able to create new work opportunities and thus guarantee a favorable profitability to give her children quality university education. She dreams of seeing them become full and successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (fabric, thread, buttons, among others).

loans.name: Ana Feliz

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer luchadora y pujante que ha sabido ganarse la vida con mucho esfuerzo. Es madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante en compañía de su esposo.
Tiene más de 35 años de experiencia en el campo de la confección, oficio que aprendió de su madre y que ahora se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Trabajó en diferentes empresas de confección, donde adquirió experiencia y perfeccionó sus técnicas; pero cuando nacieron sus hijos, tomó la decisión de independizarse y trabajar desde su casa, para estar más pendiente de ellos.
Poco a poco consiguió sus clientes y ahora presta el servicio a terceros, a los que les confecciona uniformes y prendas de dotación; cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas a quienes les ha enseñado la labor y además tiene la ventaja de contar con producción durante todo el año, ya que tiene contratos para diferentes épocas; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para brindar sustento diario a su familia.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, elásticos, entre otros); con esto podrá terminar las producciones pendientes para cumplir a los clientes de manera ágil y oportuna; dando paso para adquirir nuevos contratos.
Ana manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad y permanencia a su negocio, para que sirva como herencia para sus hijos y les permita generar recursos cuando ella falte, así podrá garantizar que sus hijos no pasarán necesidades económicas y podrán disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a strong woman and a fighter who has known how to earn a living with much effort. She is the mother of 3 children whom she has brought up in the company of her husband.

She has more than 35 years' experience in the field of sewing, a job she learned from her mother and now has been converted as her main source of income. She worked in different sewing businesses, where she acquired experience and perfected her techniques. But when her children were born she made the decision to make herself independent and work from home, to be more watchful of them.

Little by little, she obtained her clients and now offers her service to third parties, for whom she makes uniforms and work clothes. She has the support of her daughters, whom she has taught the work. In addition, she has the advantage of having production throughout the year, since she has contracts for different seasons. In this manner, she has succeeded in generating sufficient resources to offer daily sustenance to her family.

The loan she is applying for is to buy bulk supplies (fabric, thread, buttons, elastic, among others). With this, she will be able to finish pending work to fulfill the clients in an agile and opportune manner, which will give way to acquiring new contracts.

Ana says that her greatest desire is to give continuity and longevity to her business, so that it will serve as an inheritance for her children and will permit them to generate resources when she cannot. Therefore, she will be able to guarantee that her children will not lack economic necessities and that they will be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies (fabric, thread, buttons, elastic, among others).

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes arroz, menestras, aceites, leche entre otros, cuenta con clientela considerable en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de productos de primara necesidad y de esta manera abastecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sabino is 33 years old. He lives in Pucará district. Its inhabitants engage in agriculture, trade and livestock and it is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Perú.

He sells groceries such as rice, vegetable soups, oil and milk among other products. He has a sizable clientele in the area. He has requested a loan of S/.500 in order to buy basic necessities so that he can stock his business and generate more income for his family..

loans.use: to purchase basic necessities to stock his business..

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes bazar-bodega, con más de cinco años de experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de calzado y ropa para niños, damas y caballeros y de esta manera abastecer su negocio generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
46-year old María Mercedes lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotun which is located two hours from the town of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. The local people earn their living from farming, commerce, and raising livestock.

María Mercedes has a small store selling groceries etc. She's had the business for more than five years and is now seeking a loan of S/. 500 to buy footwear and clothing for men, women, and children. In this way she will have more stock to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: Buy footwear as stock for her store

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 42 years old. She is requesting a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer, during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors to enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs, during maize production.

loans.name: Kumriniso

texts.ru: Кумринисо порядочная женщина. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж строитель. Он работает в строительной бригаде. Кумринисо занимается скотоводством уже более 9 лет. Она имеет дополнительный доход от выращивания сельхоз культур. Кумринисо трудится упорно для блага получения своей семьи. Она трудится с раннего утра до позднего вечера, но ее доход маленький и она не имеет денег организовать свадьбу своей дочери, которая скоро собирается выходить замуж. Она с целью получения займа обратилась в ИМОН. Кумринисо запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 Сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kumriniso is respectable woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband works on a construction team. Kumriniso has been practicing animal husbandry for 9 years already. She earns additional income from growing crops. Kumriniso works tirelessly for the well-being of her family. She works from early in the morning to late in the evening, but her earnings are small and she doesn't have enough money to pay for the wedding of her daughter, who plans to marry soon. She came to IMON to ask for a loan. Kumriniso is asking for 5000 somoni to pay for her daughter's wedding events. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's wedding party

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married and has two children. She manages their farm, which she has been doing for three years, while her husband is working as an OFW.

Wilma is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which she will use to purchase fertilizer to boost the farm. She hopes to increase her income for a better standard of living for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marilu Noelia

texts.es:
Marilu es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Marilu no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Marilu trabaja como camarera en un restaurante de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y trato amable.
Marilu se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de una habitación en su vivienda, ella reaccionará el techado y le pondrá piso de concreto, así pues Marilu seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Marilou is 20 years old, single, and lives in the town of Chincha with her parents and siblings. She is hardworking and enthusiastic and makes a great effort to get ahead in life. Unfortunately, because she comes from a poor family and had to earn a living, she wasn't able to do any kind of job training. She found work as a waitress in a local restaurant where she works approximately ten hours every day. Everything is going well because she works hard and is friendly.

Marilou is very grateful to Kiva lenders as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to renovate a room in her house. She plans to renew the roof and put in a concrete floor. She wants to continue working and fulfilling her dream of getting a good job.

loans.use: Renovate her room

loans.name: Alfoita

texts.en:
Afloita was born and raised in Ende on the island of Flores in East Nusa Tenggara province.  She moved to the neighbouring island after getting married.  She is a famous cook in her area, selling Timorese traditional food from a pop-up stall in her yard.  She started this business to generate income to support her husband with household expenses.

To increase her income, Afloita has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies.  She will use the loan to buy stock and grow her business.  She is excited about Kopernik’s training program to improve her business skills..

Afloita plans to use the additional income to look after the needs of her three children and improve their education prospects.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to her community.

loans.name: Marthen

texts.en:
Marthen owns a small shop selling everyday goods, snacks and toiletries.  However, more shops have opened in his area and competition is tough.  He is looking for an innovative solution to improve his business.

To increase his income, Marthen has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies.  He will use this loan to buy stock and grow his business.  Marthen also hopes Kopernik’s training program will improve his business skills.

Marthen has already purchased the technologies from another Tech Kiosk to prove the efficiency of the products.  The water filter has saved him almost $50 a month already as he no longer needs to buy water.  He is therefore keen to educate his customers in the cost-savings and health benefits of the technologies.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Thavry

texts.en:
Thavry, a villager from Kampong Cham province, is 43 years old and the main breadwinner in a family consisting of six children, only one of whom is still in school.  For more than 10 years, duck raising and rice farming have been the family's main sources of income, supplemented by her husband's work in construction. 

A first-time borrower with Kiva partner VisionFund, Thavry is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer and an additional plot of farmland to enlarge her rice farming. She will also buy duck feed. Thavry hopes that these purchases will support her business and help to generate a good profit to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and an additional plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
People see Ruben as a tenacious and honest young man.  He works as a tutor for a church-based child centre.  He uses his meagre salary to live and to support his elderly mother.  Ruben wants to become an entrepreneur and earn extra income to further his education.

Ruben has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies.  He will use the loan to buy stock and further his education.  He is excited about Kopernik’s training program to improve his business skills.
.
Not far from where he lives, there are many off-grid villages where people still depend on generators or kerosene lamps.  After being introduced to solar-powered light, he saw an excellent solution for lighting his area.  He is keen to educate people in the cost-savings and health benefits of the technologies.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community

loans.name: Oktavianus

texts.en:
Oktavianus and his wife started a home business making snacks to sell to government officials, hospitals, and office employees.  Oktavianus also runs a small shop selling everyday goods, toiletries, and children’s clothing made by his wife.

To increase his income, Oktavianus has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies.  He will use the loan to buy stock and grow his business.

Oktavianus was impressed by the fuel efficiency of the cookstove and the fact that it does not produce harmful smoke.  He also understands the lack of safe drinking water available to his community.  He is looking forward to educating his customers in the cost-savings and health benefits of the technologies.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de mèches depuis 2009, Akouavi veuve et mère de 02 enfants scolarisés sollicite sa toute première demande à WAGES pour acheter des mèches qu'elle revendra à ses clients afin de tirer des bénéfices. Ce gain l'aidera à fonder une famille financièrement stable tout en rendant son activité pérenne. Elle est âgée de 33ans.
texts.en: Akouavi has been selling hair extensions since 2009. She is a widow and the mother of two children, both in school. She is seeking her very first loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions to resell to her clients and make a profit. This revenue will allow  Akouavi to ensure the financial stability of her family and make sure that her business continues. She is 33 years old.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria vive en la ciudad de Nazca, vive al lado de sus 2 hijos a quienes quiere muchísimo y por los cuales trabaja muy duro cada día para poder salir adelante. Maria trabaja como empleada en un hotel de su ciudad en el área de lavandería desde hace 2 años.

Maria esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y seguir luchando para realizar su gran sueño: Darle una profesión a  sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the city of Nazca along with her two children whom she loves very much. She works very hard every day so that her children can get ahead. Maria has worked as an employee in the laundry department of a hotel in the city for the past two years.

Maria is pleased with the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support she can buy construction materials to make improvements to her house. She will be able to improve the quality of living for her children and continue to struggle to achieve her great dream, which is to help her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Nasaratu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Nasaratu from Waterloo2, the western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children, three currently attending school. In 2009, Nasaratu established her used bag business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Nasaratu requires a loan to buy more used bags to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future; Nasaratu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used bags to expand her business.

loans.name: Esmelinda

texts.es:
Esmelida tiene 47 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores pavos, gallinas y cerdos, venta de chicha de jora, pescado y pollo, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la comprar sacos de harina y alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y así ofrecerlos a sus clientes a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Esmelinda is 47 years old and lives in the district of Morropon. The local people work in agriculture, commerce, or raise livestock. The community is known for its forests of carob trees. It is located two hours from the town of Piura on Peru's north coast.

Esmelinda earns her living raising turkeys, chickens, and pigs; she also sells chicha de jora (local drink), fish, and chicken. She is seeking a loan of S/. 2000 to buy bags of flour and special feed for the animals so she can sell them to her customers at a better price.

loans.use: Bags of flour and special animal feed

loans.name: Flormira

texts.es:
Flormira tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el caserío de Playa Azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicado en la Región de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores pavos, gallinas, cerdos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para compra de cerdos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Flormira is 49 years old. She lives in the village of Playa Azul, a rural area in the district of Pucará, located two hours from the city of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of the North Sierras of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, engage in commerce and raise livestock.

Flormira raises and sells small animals like turkeys, chickens and pigs at the back of her house. She has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy balanced feed and a second part to buy pigs. In this way she can generate more revenue for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Dekstro

texts.en:
Dekstro is a talented tailor.  He and his wife started offering sewing courses in their home to teach housewives a new skill.  The local government set up a community empowerment project and invited Dekstro to travel to small villages to teach people how to sew.  However, this income does not provide enough money for his family of four.

Dekstro has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies.  He will use the loan to buy stock and the additional income will provide much needed support to his family.

Dekstro also sees an opportunity to answer some of the problems in villages where electricity is not available.  He is keen to educate his customers in the cost-savings and health benefits of the technologies, particularly in using solar powered lamps instead of harmful kerosene.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Cool Girls Group

texts.en:
Marilyn is the featured borrower of the Cool Girls' Group. She got together with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. The group members have been  friends since they came to Lebanon to work hard to support their families in the Philippines.

Marilyn is first from the right. She is a 49-year-old divorced woman and mother of three children. She works hard to send them money to cover their living and education expenses. 

Marilyn works as a housekeeper and she misses her family a lot. The acquired loan will be sent to her children back in the Philippines to cover their education expenses. She works hard to provide them with the best education possible to make sure that they will achieve a brighter future.

She is looking forward to the day she can unite with her family forever. 
As for the other group members, Josephine is standing in the middle and Judyirene is the first from the left.

loans.use: to cover her children's education expenses in the Philippines so they will achieve a brighter future

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia de 33 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad es originaria de Nagarote lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Nagarote se destaca por su comida típica como es el quesillo. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de su familia y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar su estudio por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha para brindarle a su hijo un futuro mejor.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de quesillos, actividad que la desempeña de forma ambúlate ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo quesillo en su comunidad con una batea sobre su cabeza de unos 20 kg. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de materia prima para elaborar el quesillo como queso  quesillo, tortillas, cebolla, chile, repollo, bolsas, servilletas, crema. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is 33 years old, married and has one child. She is a native of Nagarote, a place in the west of the country. Nagarote is famous for the elaboration of traditional food such as quesillo (a cheese filled tortilla).

María Eugenia is a hard-working responsible person who wants to get ahead. In her spare time she likes to be with her family spending quality time. Unfortunately due to modest finances she could not continue her studies. Today she fights to give her son a better future. Thanks to her efforts and desire to improve she sells quesillos door-to-door as a business. She spends 8 hours a day with a 20 kilogram hamper on her head offering her goods to her community.

María Eugenia is requesting a loan to invest in working capital to buy raw materials to make the quesillos like cheese, tortilla, onions, chilies, cabbage, bags, serviettes and cream. María is grateful for the support that the lenders at Kiva offer to people of modest resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can enjoy dignified employment.

loans.use: to stock her business with raw materials like cheese, tortillas, onion, chile, cabbage, bags, serviettes and cream.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Meet Umu, a 48-year-old married mother of seven from Waterloo2, the western rural area in Freetown. In 2001, Umu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to contribute the education of her children. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a transportation problem.

Umu requires a loan to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Umu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 44 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city which is in Lori region. Gayane works at the hospital as a nurse. She is much respected by her colleagues and she does her work with great care and pleasure. She is married and she has a son and a daughter. Her son works at a café as a barman-waiter and her daughter is a student at a medical college and in future wants to be a midwife. Gayane’s husband is a builder and the family has a normal income. Soon Gayane’s daughter is going to get married and the family is not prepared to meet these expanses.
Gayane asks a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams to buy some gifts for her daughter’s fiancé and also to cover expanses connected with the wedding party.

loans.use: to buy some gifts for her daughter’s fiancé and also to cover other expanses connected with wedding party

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 26 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien vive junto a su esposa y su  hijo. el se dedica a la pesca artesanal, contando con dos lanchas y algunas redes para obtener mariscos. el cual incluso ahora le permite salir adelante. El cliente solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más redes para pescar, también anzuelos y otros instrumentos necesarios para realizar la pesca diariamente, desea darles una mejor vida a su familia en donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en: This client of twenty-six years of age is a very responsible and hardworking person who lives together with his wife and son. He is an artisan fisherman who relies on two small boats and some fishing nets to catch shellfish. This activity, even now, allows him to get ahead. The client is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL through which he may be able to have the necessary funds to buy more fishing nets, fishing hooks, and other needed fishing tools. He hopes to provide his family with a better life where they could have all that they need.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fish hooks, and other tools.

loans.name: Nozim

texts.en:
Nozim is married and lives in a rural area. He makes furniture, doors, and windows,  which he has been doing for more than 18 years. He has a workshop. 

Nozim is requesting a loan for 5,000 somoni, which he will use to buy wood and increase working capital.

loans.use: to purchase wood for making furniture, doors, and windows

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 33-year-old married woman with two children who are attending to school. She has a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell every harvest season. Farming is the important source of the family’s income. She has been doing this for more than 13 years.

Sokha has applied for a loan of 600 US dollars to drill a well and install a hand pump well on the top of the drilled well. She is hoping that she won’t face a water shortage in the future or she won't have to spend much time collecting water from the far-distant areas anymore. She expresses her thanks to all Kiva lenders for showing their interest in poor people like her.

loans.use: to drill a well and install a hand pump well on the top of the drilled well.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla femme de 45ans, vit avec son conjoint menuisier et leurs 05 enfants tous scolarisés à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse de légumes au marché cela depuis 1998. Elle s'y plait bien car cette activité lui permet de tirer des bénéfices pour contribuer au besoins de la famille. Afin de garder sa clientèle, elle sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à élargir son étalage afin de vendre des produits d’alimentation générale et construire plus tard une maison.
texts.en:
Abla is a 45-year-old woman, who lives in Lomé with her partner (a carpenter) and their five children who are all at school. She has worked reselling vegetables in the market since 1998, and is happy because she can use the income she obtains from this business to provide for her family. 

In order to keep her customers, Abla has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise. The profit she makes will help her to expand her stall so that she can sell general food items, as well as helping her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma provides services such as cake baking for birthdays and other occasions. She has been operating the business for 12 years and earns a good living. Gemma also accepts made to order cakes for all occasions. Her previous loan from GDMPC was used to buy more equipment to improve the business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy raw ingredients to cook. Gemma desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to cook.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael used his prior loan for 12,000 PHP to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of his tricycle. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and for his family's personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Ismael is requesting another loan for 15,000 PHP, which he will use to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle. He will also buy some equipment in the repair shop. His profits from his business will help him to sustain his family's daily needs and educational expenses of his children. 

Ismael hopes to be able to buy another tricycle and hopes that his children will finish their studies. Every week, he meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business and to study God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Ma. Heidi

texts.en:
This is Ma. Heidi. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment.  Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Heidi dreams of having another apartment and hopes to save for her future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partner/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable stall operators in her business. The previous loan helped her a lot and she appreciates that.
 
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Yordin

texts.es: Yordin  tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el y a su familia  a salir adelante. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yordin is 40 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children. The loan he needs is to buy cattle. When they are grown he will sell them for a profit. The cattle business helps him and his family get ahead. He hopes that with this project he grows and can attain his objectives. He hopes to offer his family a higher quality of living and a more stable financial stability in the future. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans from the State banks. FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan on better terms and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 37 years old and has five children. Rowena is married and has two children who are still in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been raising pigs for 23 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Martha from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2000, Martha established her clothing materials business. She began her business because she wanted to avoid idleness. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Martha requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing materials to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future; Martha plans to own a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing materials to expand her business

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy, residing in Dambae district in Kampong Cham province, is a 31-year-old mother of four dependent children; three school children and one little kid. She struggles for a living via cassava farming and working for others for a fee as supplementary income. This is the first loan for Chanthy with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). With this loan, she is planning to buy a decent mini-tractor and to pay for labor fees. She has strong hopes that she can make a good profit from her business so that she can keep her kids in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy a mini-tractor for plowing her land and pay for her rice and cassava labor fees

loans.name: Raïnatou

texts.fr: raïnatou est une femme de 40 ans, mariée mère d'un enfant. elle possède et gère une boutique de vente de pagnes pour femme dans un quartier de la ville depuis 10 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des pagnes provenant du Sénégal afin d'augmenter ses ventes et satisfaire sa clientèle. les profits générés vont être réinvestis dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins éducatif de son enfant
texts.en: Rainatou is a 40-year old woman. She is married and has one child. She owns and manages a store, where she sells traditional “pagnes” fabrics for women. She has been working there for 10 years. She is seeking a credit in order to replenish her merchandise stock by buying “pagnes” from Senegal in order to increase her sales volume and meet customer demand. Her profits will be reinvested in her business and used to cover education expenses for her child.

loans.use: to buy traditional "pagnes" fabric.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.fr: Merlin est un homme de 32 ans, fiancé et père de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 2 et 12 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont à l'école. Il commerçant et vend les glaces dans la capitale depuis 10 ans. c'est grâce à cette activité qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Son activité fonctionne bien mais il a besoin de capital pour augmenter ses ventes ainsi que son bénéfice. bénéfice qui sera réinvesti en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Merlin is a 32-year-old man, who is engaged to be married and is the father of five children aged between 2 and 12. Three of his children go to school. He works selling ice creams in the capital, and has done so for 10 years. It is thanks to this that he is able to provide for his family.

Merlin's business is doing well, but he needs capital to increase his sales and his profits. He plans to reinvest part of these profits in expanding his business, and will use the rest to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy four bags of powdered sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Ban Pe - D8A Group

texts.en:
This is about Mrs. Dinh, a 50-year-old Thai woman who puts great effort into life. 

She got divorced from her husband of 5 years because he was using opium drug. Now she's living with her two children: one's in grade 9 and the other is in medical school. She has had to bring up her kids on her own since they were born because her husband was very irresponsible. She is a nurse, but to cover all living expenses and pay tuition fees for the kids, she works at many agriculture activities, including cultivating rice, vegetables, breeding chickens, ducks and pigs. 

This is her first loan in the Anh Chi Em Program and she wants to use a portion of the loan to buy food for chickens and ducks. She dreams her children will have a better life by having good jobs with high salaries.

Dinh is the team leader of Ban Pe - D8A Group ,which consists of 6 Thai ladies. In the picture, she stands first from the left.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and ducks

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба молодая женщина, которая пережила очень тяжелую жизнь. Ей 24 года. Она росла в бедной семье. Ее отец рано умер. Для того, чтобы помочь, матери, они с сестрой поехали в Российскую Федерация на заработки. Они там проработали несколько времени и приехали на Родину. Она вышла замуж, но ее брак был неудачным, и она рассталась с мужем. Данное время она имеет дочку и воспитывает ее сама. Насиба недавно приехала с Российской Федерации и купила квартиру. Она несколько месяцев назад устроилась на работу. Насиба работает официанткой в кафе. Насиба и ее дочь живут на ее зарплату. Насиба хочет отремонтировать свою квартиру, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как краски, цемент и т.п. для ремонта. Она надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nasiba is a young woman who has had many hardships in her life already. She is 24 years old. She grew up in a poor family. Her father died early. In order to help her mother, she and her sister traveled to Russia as migrant workers. They worked in Russia for some time and then returned to their home country. Nasiba got married, but her marriage was not happy, and she divorced her husband. Now she is a single mother bringing up her daughter alone. Nasiba recently returned from the Russian Federation and bought an apartment. Several months ago she started a new job. She works as a waitress in a café. Nasiba’s salary goes to support herself and her daughter. Nasiba would like to renovate her apartment but lacks the funds. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 TJS to buy construction materials such as paint, cement etc for the renovation works. She is counting on your compassion.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovating her flat.

loans.name: Camia Group

texts.en:
Vilma is the featured borrower of Camia group. She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.  They have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines, and decided to work as housekeepers here in Lebanon to provide the necessary standard of living to their families back home.

Vilma is a 42-year-old married mother of four children who works as a housekeeper to support her family back in the Philippines. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to send it to her family to make sure they are going to have a special Christmas celebration since she works hard to ensure they get everything they might need.

Vilma is the second from the right side of the picture with a pink jacket. As for the other group members, Cleofe is the first from the right, Marites the first from the left, and Mariesyl is the second from the left.

loans.use: to send it to her family to make sure that they are going to have a special Christmas celebration since she works hard to ensure they get everything they might need.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She also sells pots made of clay materials. She has been running the business for 11 years and she earns enough that she has been able to provide for her family's needs and repay her previous loans successfully. 

Currently, Erlinda is borrowing a new loan to purchase more grocery goods for resale to boost her retail store. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for resale

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is 45 years old and is a widow who currently lives with father and two children in a rural village of Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham province. She has a small plantation and grows rice and cassava to earn a living. She has been doing this for years and with the help of her children she is able to earn USD 5 per day on average. 

Eng has requested a loan to hire laborers to help her harvest cassava on her plantation. She has been an honest client with HKL for three loans and has repaid successfully. Eng hopes to sell her cassava in the local markets at a good price. Her goal is to improve her plantation and to support her family.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help her harvest cassava on her plantation.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Aminata from Waterloo2, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. Aminata started her business to take care of her family. 

Aminata runs a retails business at home - she sells teddy bears within her community. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at her business throughout the week, from morning to night. Aminata says that the main challenge to her business is the price of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more teddy bears for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more teddy bears for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three children . She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a shop, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby, who are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and soap. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and soap

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Mamusu from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with two children. She started business to take care of her family. 

Mamusu runs a food stand business at home; she sells rice, palm oil and cooking oil. She has been running this business since 2004. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Mamusu says that the main challenge to her business is the price of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Mamusu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional stock of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Jaime De Jesús

texts.es:
Jaime, a sus 68 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo al que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo.
Cuenta con más de 40 años de experiencia laboral, trabajando en el comercio y desde hace 10 años se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una charcutería en la que ofrece gaseosas, mecato, dulces, cervezas, licor y alimentos fritos que su esposa prepara; además presta el servicio de alquiler de billares para entretenimiento de sus visitantes; esto le ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar las necesidades de su hogar y además pudo darle educación a su hijo.
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, cervezas, licor, gaseosas, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad suficiente para atender la demanda de su clientela, mejorando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.
Jaime tiene como propósito seguir trabajando en el fortalecimiento de su negocio hasta que Dios y su cuerpo se lo permitan, pues desea dejarlo como herencia a su hijo para garantizarle así una estabilidad económica favorable que le permita vivir en mejores condiciones y con un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Jaime, 68, is married and the father of a child whom he has gotten ahead with great effort.

He has more than 40 years of work experience in commerce.  For 10 years he has made a living with his own business, a deli where he sells soda, pastry, sweets, beer, liquor, and fried food that his wife makes.  He also rents a pool table for his customer's enjoyment.  This has earned him enough income to pay for his household necessities as well as his son's education.

Jaime wants to invest his loan in buying stock wholesale (pastry, beer, liquor, soda, and other things).  This will given him enough resources to respond to customer demand and improve his sales and income.

Jaime's goal is to keep on working to strengthen his business as long as God and his body allow.  He wants to leave his business to his son to ensure him favorable economic stability so he'll enjoy better living conditions and greater well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale

loans.name: Snow White Group

texts.en:
Madeline is the featured borrower of Snow White group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.  They trust each other a lot, because they became close friends when they arrived in Lebanon to work as housekeepers to provide a good living for their precious families.

Madeline is a 52-year-old, married mother of three children, who works as a housekeeper to support her family's living. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to send the money to her beloved family in her hometown in the Philippines to make sure that they'll be capable of celebrating the special Christmas spirit.

Madeline is the first lady from the left side of the picture.  As for the other group members, Ritadel is the lady at the center of the picture, and Maria Theresa  is the first from the right.

loans.use: to send the money to her beloved family in her hometown in the  Philippines to make sure that they will be capable of celebrating the special Christmas spirit.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en: Mastura is the only breadwinner for her three non-adult children. Her husband died a year ago. Mastura has been busy with selling dried fruits and nuts for more than two years. She sells dried fruits and nuts in a local market. She has her regular customers. Mastura lives poorly as her income is not enough. Mastura must buy clothes for her children for the winter season and also she must buy coal, but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy clothes and coal. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy coal and clothes for her children for the winter season

loans.name: Marya

texts.en:
Marya is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and her six children in Nablus. Five of the children attend the public primary school.

Marya is asking Ryada for this loan that will allow her to put shutters on the windows and to extend electricity to her house. This will help her to take a step forward because she has a shortage of money.

Marya is very grateful to everyone who helps her. The one who appears in the photo is her husband. For reasons of culture, Marya can’t publish her photos online, for which she apologizes.

loans.use: to put shutters on the windows and to extend electricity to her house.

loans.name: Jhondy

texts.en: Jhondy is studying for his BS - Business Administration at Stella Maris College. His previous loan from GDMPC was used for books and study materials costs. Currently, he requests another loan to pay for textbooks and school materials. He is grateful for this opportunity and the support he has received, and he plans to put his studies first in order to gain success and be able to help his parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks and school materials

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip is a member of Amani Group in Matete District.  He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 48 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Philip has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

Philip is a reliable member of the community.  He is married and has seven children.  Philip is 38 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 25 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Philip is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group and savings group.  He described his harvest last year as excellent.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue with the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							
			
Philip first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Philip joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and earn enough to feed his family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader.  As an active community member, he wants to help more farmers.  Philip plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, save for the future, and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Philip’s own life has improved because he has more profits from his harvest and has been able to save money and feed his family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Philip and the Amani Group will use the Kiva loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seed and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting seasons to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une dame âgé de 37 ans marié, mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie de 15 à 6 ans. Elle fait dans la décoration de robes de mariage, la vente des chaussures et habits. son activité date d'un ans déjà mais jusqu'ici elle ne parvient pas a satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui devient un peut trop élevés par rapport a son chiffre d'affaire. elle souhaite augmenter celui-ci, pourvoir satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et agrandir sa structure. avec le bénéfice réalisé par ce crédit elle compte utilisée une partie pour réinvestir et l'autre part pour la satisfaction des besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 37-year-old woman, who is married and has three children aged between 6 and 15. She works accessorizing wedding dresses and selling clothing and shoes. She has already been working in this business for a year, but to date she has been unable to meet the needs of her customers, as she now has a high number of customers compared to her turnover. 

Marie wants to increase her turnover, meet customer demand and increase her business structure. With the profits she will make from this loan, she plans to reinvest in her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which helped him to buy artificial fertilizer for wheat and corn. The loan has helped him to continue to be able to work the land and to reduce costs. He is still working in agriculture and now is also keeping two cows and one horse. He uses the horse for transporting wood that he sells to others for heating during the wintertime. 

Now he is requesting a second loan in order to renovate his stable. He hopes in the future to buy another cow and to start selling milk in his neighborhood. He is very grateful for both loans and wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To renovate the stable

loans.name: Mustafo

texts.ru: Мустафо 27 лет. Он живет в городке Нурек с женой и двумя детьми. Мустафо имеет малый бизнес. Он 9 лет назад начал торговлю продуктов питания. Его магазин расположен в хорошем месте, что способствует увеличению клиентов. Мустафо продает в своем магазине такие продукты, как колбасные изделия, молочные продукты, консервированные продукты, сладости, конфеты, шоколад, кофе, чай, сахар, прохладительные напитки, детское питание и т.д. Мустфао очень хороший продавец и бизнесмен. Некоторые его клиенты делают ему заказы прямо через телефон. Сейчас Мустафо должен привезти партию товара, но у него не хватает собственных средств. Он просит в кредит 2100 долларов США. На эту сумму он закупит ассортимент свежих и качественных продуктов питания в магазин. Ему нужна ваша поддержка.
texts.en: Mustafo is 27 years old. He lives in the town of Nurek with his wife and two children. Mustafo has a small business. Nine years ago, he started selling groceries. His shop is in a good location, which increases the number of customers. Mustafo sells products such as sausages, dairy products, canned foods, sweets, candy, chocolate, coffee, tea, sugar, soft drinks, baby food, etc. Mustafo is a very good salesman and businessman. Some of his clients even order goods by phone. Now Mustafo needs to buy goods but doesn't have the money. He is asking for a loan of $2,100 USD. He will use this sum to purchase a variety of fresh, high-quality foods for his store. He needs your support.

loans.use: buy food to sell.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul is 50 years old. She is a divorcee and has four children. She also has some grandchildren. She is an experienced seamstress and has been busy with her sewing business more than six years. She has her repeat clients and additional income from growing vegetables such as potatoes and carrots. Her children help her with growing and selling vegetables. 

One of her sons is going to be married but she has not enough money to organize his marriage party. Her son really wants to get married. Ugul is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to give a wedding party. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To give a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 34 years old and married. She has a child who still depends on her income. Mai is engaged in a farming business and a traveling sales business. She works in farming during the rainy season and sells rattan products, salt, and fermented fish along with her husband from a horse-pulled cart in the other season. From her current businesses, she is able to make an income of KHR 40,000 per day on average.

Mai currently needs a loan to buy a horse for her traveling sale business. With the help of the loan, she will be able to continue her business in a sustainable way and hopes to make a consistent income for her family. Mai and her family members greatly appreciate the lenders' support and will be grateful to them for their help in providing the needed loan.

loans.use: to buy a horse for her traveling sales business.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en: Amor studies BS- Business Administration at the University of Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old and has been striving hard to finish her courses. She joined GDMPC and got a solution for her financial needs. She borrowed a loan to pay the school tuition fee. In the future, Amor wants to be successful and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en: Mastura was born in 1971. She is married and has a child. For more than 10 years, Mastura has been busy with animal husbandry. Her husband helps her to fatten their cattle. She is very experienced in this field and little by little developed her business. She always wanted to provide living conditions with all the necessities, but she does not have enough money to do that. She wants to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village of Sachkhere district with her husband Goderdzi and two children. Nona is unemployed at the moment, in spite of being highly educated. There is a high unemployment rate in the region especially among people up to 40. Her family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have cows whose milk is used in cheese products, and they also have a bit of agricultural land where they grow different kinds of vegetables.

As their current income is not enough for a four-member family and Nona can’t find a job, she requested a loan for a family business. All the financial institutions rejected her loan request because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Nona applied for a loan from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  A loan of $1,600 will help Nona to purchase a secondhand car. Goderdzi will drive the car and they will transport fruits and vegetables to sell. This credit will be a great support for the family. Nona is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a used car for transportation

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives in Stepanavan city which is in Lori region. She is 35 years old and she is a mother of two nice children. Ani has graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical University and now she works at a school as a teacher of mathematics. Her husband is also employed and he is an electrician. Ani is a very kind and clever pedagogue and she is much respected. Her children are also very duteous and clever and they realize the importance of education and the value of an educated person.

 Ani asks for a loan of 320,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer, which will be very useful both for her and for her children, and she also wants to buy some professional literature for her teaching activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature for her teaching activities

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in the village of Gegharkunik which is in the Gegharkunik region. He is 39 years old. Samvel is married, but his wife is temporally in the Russian Federation and at this moment he lives alone. He takes care of a cute farm that he established himself. On his farm he has five cows, two heifers, five piglets, and twelve sheep. He sells milk and meat to his loyal customers, who buy his products right from his house. 

With the coming of winter and cold weather, Samvel worries greatly about how his cattle will weather the season. He is seeking a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy two more cows and a lot of animal fodder for winter.

loans.use: to buy two more cows and a lot of animal fodder for winter

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. In 2010, Salamatu established her general store business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and improper business location.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and Pure Water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and build a permanent business location. In the future, Salamatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and Pure Water.

loans.name: Sarukhan

texts.en:
Sarukhan is 29 years old and he lives in Stepanavan city in Lori region. He is not married and he lives with his parents. Sarukhan has a higher education and he works in the military sphere. For many years, his father has devoted his life to the defense of his motherland but now he is retired and his son continues his work with the same enthusiasm and devotion. Sarukhan’s mother works at the sewing factory as a tailor. Sarukhan works very hard and he really wants to improve their living conditions, but still there are a lot of everyday problems and with the coming of winter, there are even more problems. 

Sarukhan is asking for a loan of 400.000 Armenian drams in order to buy warm and new clothes for his parents and, if he can manage, he wants to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy new, warm clothes for his parents and a computer

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
