Meet 28-year-old Sarah from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children.  She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. In 2007, Sarah established her food business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00  pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Sarah requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Sarah plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stuff

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Aleksandar

texts.en: Aleksandar is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support. He has used the loan to buy various components used for producing animal food, turning wheat and other grains into food. He is still doing the same business and is very satisfied with the income that he earns from his business, particularly since there is not much competition in this area and he is able to make a large profit. With the help of his prior loan, he was able to expand his business and he is now requesting a second loan in order to buy a new machine and other tools for producing animal feed from wheat. The loan will help him to expand his business even further and ensure financial stability for the family’s future. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy new equipment to produce animal feed

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Charles. He is married, and has one child, age one. In 2011, Charles began operating a mobile phone shop. He began his business to be self-reliant after coming from the village to Accra. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are everybody. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, Charles earns about GHS 120 every month from this business. 

Charles would like a loan in the amount of GHS 1,200 to buy a specific phone ordered by a customer. He has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his stock and to make more profit. In the future, Charles hopes to improve his business and expand to other towns. He started the business hawking around the town and now owns a small shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a specific phone ordered by a customer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 26 años de edad, vive en casa propia lugar en el cual posee su propia granja de cerdos en la cual se dedica a comprar cerdos tiernos los cuales cría y posteriormente comercializa. El negocio esta ubicado en la zona rural por lo que cuenta con un lugar muy apto para este tipo de trabajo,el cliente es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años de edad,  desde hace varios años se dedica a este trabajo, el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco, a pesar de esto él cuenta con una cantidad de clientes muy aceptable, por lo que desea contar con mayor cantidad de cerdos para extender aún más su negocio, es por esto que él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir comprando: concentrado para cerdos, vitaminas, y así mismo mejorar el lugar en el cual habitan sus crías, de manera que el estándar de calidad sea aún más alto y así brindar un mejor servicio, el cual le permita mejorar sus ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This client is 26 years old, and lives in his own house along with his own pig farm. He works buying young piglets which he raises and later sells. The business is located in a rural area which is why he has a very suitable place for this kind of work. The client is very responsible and hard-working. He lives with his wife and 3-year old son.

For several years he has worked at this business, which he was been growing bit by bit. Despite this, he has a very acceptable quantity of clients, which is why he wants to increase the number of pigs he has, and to expand his business even more. This is why he is asking for a loan which he would invest in: buying pig feed and vitamins, and also improving the area where he raises the piglets. This will improve the quality of his stock and offer a better service, which will increase his earnings and afford him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and improve the pig sty.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula es un mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo tiene su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y ropa con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, sobre todo porque tiene 2 hijo a los cuales ama muchísimo.

Ursula gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que podrá terminar de construir su baño, de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para poder terminar de construir su vivienda y poder darle una profesión a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ursula is a woman with much desire to get ahead. For this reason, with much effort, she has a business selling beauty products and clothing, with which she can have income to be able to get her family ahead. Above all, because she has two children who she loves very much.

Ursula, thanks to the help of the Kiva lenders, will be able to carry out improvements in her home given that she will be able to finish constructing her bathroom. In this manner, she will be able to continue striving to be able to finish constructing her home and be able to give a profession to her children.

loans.use: for the construction of a bathroom.

loans.name: Ninel

texts.en:
Ninel is a mother of two grown-up children. In 2012, she started her retail business. Particularly, Ninel purchases different products (home supplies, clothing, etc.) and resells them from her house. Due to her kind attitude toward people and the good quality products that she sells, Ninel gained the trust of her clients. As the main breadwinner of the family, it is very difficult for her to cover her family's needs. She currently needs financial support to be able to purchase new products and resell them to her customers. 

Ninel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly help Ninel to continue her retail business and meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: to pay for new products (home supplies, clothing, etc.) to sell to customers

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara, aged 28, is an experienced farmer from the small village of Santuk, Kampong Thom. She has been married for many years, but she doesn’t have a child yet. To meet the family’s needs, Sara and her husband are engaged in the cultivation of rice, which she sells in the local markets after every harvest season. This is the major source of income for her family.

As their needs are increasing, Sara needs to expand her farming business to be able to effectively meet the family's needs. That’s why she is asking for a loan, which will enable her to buy a plowing machine for the maintenance at the rice fields. The loan will help the family sustain their agricultural business. Sara will be thankful to all lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine for the maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Mariama from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2007, Mariama established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her family's standard of living and educate her daughter. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that her main challenge is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy food containers and clothing materialsto expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future; Mariama plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food containers and clothing materials to expand her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Meet Anita. She is 30 years old and is from Waterloo2 in the Eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children.  In 2010, Anita established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operating area.

Anita requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Anita plans to open a foodstuffs table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata, a 32-year-old from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  In 2010, Fatmata established her food business. She began her business because she wanted to develop herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is her transportation problem.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a foodstuffs table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with children.  She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. In 2011, Kadiatu established her retail business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and Pure Water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and Pure Water.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José  es soltero, de 42 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos: tres varones y dos mujeres; el mayor de sus hijos le apoya en la generación de sus ingresos; él junto a su familia vive en Aldea Los Encuentros, Sololá. Se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte (taxi y pick up); esto lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive, cuenta que el se dedica a esta actividad porque existe mucha demanda en su comunidad debido a que está cerca de una de las carreteras más concurridas de Guatemala y que existe mucho movimiento tanto de personas  comunes como de comerciantes que necesitan movilizar su mercadería a sus negocios. Esta labor es de donde el obtiene la mayor parte de los ingresos que utiliza para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Otra fuente de ingresos de José es la agricultura, además tiene negocio de abarrotes en Sololá, el cual es atendido por su hijo mayor.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de repuestos para la reparación del motor de su pick up.
Sueña con mejorar  las condiciones de su vivienda y adquirir otro vehículo mas reciente para seguir prestando el servicio de transporte.
texts.en:
José is single, 42 years old and has 5 children: three boys and two girls. The oldest of his children contributes to the household income. He lives with his family in the small town of Los Encuentros, Sololá.

He makes his living offering transport services (taxi and pick-up). He does this in the community where he lives. He says that he is in this business because there is a lot of demand in his community, since it is near one of the busiest highways of Guatemala, and that there is as much movement of normal people as of businessmen who need to transport merchandise to their businesses. This work is where he obtains the majority of his income that he uses to cover family expenses.

Another source of income for José is agriculture, as well as a grocery store in Sololá, which is tended by his oldest son.

He is applying for a loan of Q 8,000.00 to buy spare parts to repair the engine of his pick-up.

He dreams of improving the condition of his house and of getting a newer vehicle in order to continue offering transport services.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair the engine of his pick-up.

loans.name: Dayan Fernando

texts.es:
Dayan es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad que se dedica a elaborar herraduras; el oficio lo aprendió de su padre y adquirió experiencia trabajando como empleado pero, desde hace aproximadamente 2 años inició su labor como independiente, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos que le permitieran aportar para el sustento del hogar.
Su propósito con el crédito es comprar materia prima al por mayor (varillas, láminas de hierro y carbón), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y satisfacer la demanda actual de su producto; lo que le ayudará a mejorar las ventas e ingresos que percibe.
Dayan tiene como meta principal fortalecer y hacer crecer su negocio, que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio para ser más competitivos en el mercado, dando paso a un mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida y bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Dayan is a enterprising young man. He is 23 years old and works making horseshoes. He learned this profession from his father and acquired experience working as an employee, but approximately two years ago he started working for himself with the aim of increasing his income, which will allow him to support his household.

His intention with the loan is to buy raw materials in bulk (bars, sheets of iron, and coal) which will allow him to continue his work and satisfy the current demand for his products. This will then help him to improve sales and the earnings he receives.

Dayan's main goal is to strengthen and develop his business. This will allow him to create job opportunities, which will improve the profitability of the business and allow him to be more competitive in the market. This will then lead to an improvement in the living conditions and the well-being of Dayan's family.

loans.use: buy raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Olga Livia

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 49 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Olga no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Olga trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Olga se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, ya que al acercarse la época navideña desea venderlos para obtener un poco mas de dinero, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Olga is a 49 year-old woman, she lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and her 2 children. She is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and along with her husband they dedicate all of their energy to getting their family ahead. Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources and for the need to work, Olga could not study a professional career.

By her own initiative, Olga works offering cleaning services in a municipal business in her city. She works every day for approximately 8 hours and believes that it's going well because of her dedication and good effort.

Olga is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they give she will buy clothing for women, men and children. Since it's getting close to the Christmas season she wishes to sell them to obtain a little bit more money. Therefore she will continue working and pushing herself to obtain her great dream of seeing her children converted into good professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet Zainab. She is 28 years old, from Waterloo2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with three children.  

In 2012, Zainab established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase more equipment to expand her stove business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. 

In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business to become a stove factory. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to expand her stove business.

loans.name: Angie Nayibe

texts.es:
Angie Nayibe es una estudiante de atención integral a la primera infancia que estudia en campo alto en la sede de Teusaquillo.
 
La cual le pide una ayuda a Kiva porque hace unos meses la madre de la joven está desempleada la cual es una madre cabeza de  hogar que responde por los tres hijos el cual también está estudiando.
La joven quiere seguir estudiando ya que quiere ayudar a la madre y ha visto el esfuerzo de ella para seguir estudiando y ese es el sueño de ella, ser alguien en la vida porque le gusta la carrera, porque desde que estaba en el colegio tenía la ilusión de realizar esta carrera porque le ha tocado muy duro para el estudio por la situación económica
 
Ella quiere seguir estudiando en campo alto porque le ha parecido excelente la enseñanza. También le ha tocado conseguir para los transportes porque es complicado llegar por la inseguridad de la ciudad.
 
Por esta razón pide cordialmente que kiva le ayudara con algún descuento en dichas cuotas ya que ella está muy interesada en seguir, Ya que en el primer semestre  quedo muy pesado pagar las cuotas a tiempo.
Espera una pronta respuesta para saber si la joven se puede matricular y seguir con el tercer semestre
 
Muchas Gracias por su colaboración prestada.
texts.en:
Angie Nayibe is one of three children of a single mother who all attend school. She is studying Early Childhood Education at  Campo Alto in the Teusaquillo section of Bogota. Angie is asking for help from Kiva because her mother has been unemployed for several months. 
 
Angie wants to continue her studies so that she can help her mother. She's seen how hard her mother has worked to allow Angie and her siblings to get an education. Angie's great ambition since she was in high school has been to have a teaching career, even though her family's financial difficulties make it hard for her to continue her studies.  

Angie wants to continue her program at Campo Alto because she has fund the instruction to be excellent. She is committed to continuing her program even tough the commute to Campo Alto has been difficult because the city can be dangerous. 

Angie is therefore respectfully asking for help from Kiva to pay her tuition, which was a heavy burden during her first semester. Angie is hoping for a prompt response so she'll know if she can enroll and continue with her third semester. 

Angie is extremely grateful for the support of lenders.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for a semester.

loans.name: Faqra Group

texts.en:
Ermalyn is the featured borrower of Faqra group. She managed to get a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to cover some of her unexpectedly increased family needs in the Philippines.

Ermalyn is a 40-year-old married mother of two children. She works as a housekeeper to financially support her family in a well-managed way. Ermalyn's acquired loan will be sent to her family back in the Philippines to cover her beloved children's unexpected increased school fees. She is working hard to provide her children with the best education ever to make sure that they will be responsible people in their region.

Ermalyn is is the first from the right with a jeans jacket, Julie Ann is at the center of the picture, and Fortunata is on the left.

loans.use: To cover her beloved children's unexpected increased tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Edilberto.

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 31 años, y trabaja como profesor de danzas típicas, Edilberto ya lleva enseñando hace 10 años, sobre todo porque lo hace con mucho amor por la danza y sobre todo porque las danzas típicas peruanas son maravillosas y hermosas y Edilberto cree que le va muy bien porque ama lo que hace.

Edilberto gracias a los prestamistas kiva podrá comprar vestimentas nuevas para sus clases, ya que el va participar en concursos y actualmente las vestimentas que tiene se encuentran desgastadas, así el podrá seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño de tener una gran escuela de danzas y poder llevar las danzas típicas peruanas alrededor del mundo”.
texts.en:
Edilberto, 31, has been teaching traditional dance for 10 years. He loves to teach because traditional Peruvian dances are marvelous and beautiful, and things are going well because he loves what he does.

Edilberto thanks the Kiva lenders because he will be able to buy new garments for his classes. He is going to participate in competitions, and the costumes he has are worn out. He will keep striving to achieve his great dream of having a dance school and performing traditional Peruvian dances around the world.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Togotane Group

texts.en:
This group pictured belong to two men with the same interest, farming. They both aspire to grow socially and economically through farming.
Andrew, raising up his hand, has been a member of the group since the 2013 long rains. He is 21 years old and married with one child. He is requesting a loan from Kiva. 

With the help of Kiva loan, he will be able to purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds of sorghum, millet, and maize. The farm inputs will enable him to get a good harvest. The produce he gets from the harvest will be efficient for food in his household. He will sell the surplus and pay school fees for his post-secondary education. This will increase his chances of getting employment in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is a 26-year-old from the Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Her children are currently attending school. In 2009, Isatu established her used clothing material business. She began her business because she wants to improve her family's standard of living. She works at her business for 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main business challenge is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and become successful. In the future, she plans to own a larger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Einar Roberto

texts.es: Einar Roberto, 48 años de edad casado con dos hijas menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, el turismo por sus hermosas playas, El se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal; en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar con sus familia en actividades recreativas como ir al parque, al cine y pasar tiempo de calidad todos juntos. Einar está solicitando un financiamiento para rellenar con material selecto como: piedrin, tierra, boronas de desechos entre otros para un área de terreno de 6 metros por 20 metros (120 metros cuadrados) existe la necesidad de esta inversión ya que donde viven actualmente está muy próximo a la playa, en la actualidad es trabajador activo de una empresa donde brindan el servicio de seguridad, Einar ya ha trabajado con fundación el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Los sueños de este hombre es terminar y ver formados a sus hijos en profesionales y poder construir su casa de habitación para tener un techo digno donde vivir.-
texts.en:
Einar Roberto is 48 years old, married, and has two young daughters who still depend on him.  He is from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, an area dominated by business, tourism, and its beautiful beaches.  He is known for being a hardworking, responsible man with a personal desire to get ahead.  He spends his free time doing recreational activities with his family, such as going to the park, the movies, and spending quality time together.

Einar is asking for a loan to buy pebbles, dirt, rubble and other things for a 6m by 20m (120 square meter) plot of land.  He needs to do this because they live near the beach.  He currently works for a company as a security guard.  Einar has worked with the foundation and has shown himself to be responsible with his payments.  His dream is to see his children become professionals and be able to build a house so that he will have a roof over his head.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Maria Rosana

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Maria no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Maria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buena sazón.
Maria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará juguetes, ya que al acercarse la época navideña desea incursionar en este negocio para poder obtener un poco mas de ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para lograr su gran sueño de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and lives with her son in the city of Chincha.  She is a hardworking single mother who puts forth all her efforts to get her family ahead.  Unfortunately, she was not able to pursue a professional career due to a lack of resources and a need to work.

Maria has a small business selling food, works for about 10 hours every day, and she feels that things are going well for her because of her good seasonings.

Maria is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to them she will buy toys for the upcoming Christmas season.  She wants to be able to generate a bit more income, which will be very helpful in achieving her great dream of fixing up her home.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Felista

texts.es:
Felista tiene 53 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de chivos y aves de corral tiene clientela considerable, son una familia unida su esposo se dedica a la venta de mariscos en los restaurants de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de chivos para ofrecerlos por campaña navideña y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Felista is 53 years old and lives with her husband in the Cayalti district, where its population are merchants, farmers, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.  She has been raising and selling goats and has steady customers.  Her husband sells seafood to the restaurants in the area.  She is asking for this loan of 2,000 New Soles to buy goats to offer her customers over the Christmas season and increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr: Avec ce quatrième crédit sollicité dans notre institution WAGES, madame Kokoé va s'approvisionner en ustensiles de cuisine. Activité qu'elle depuis 1998 et qui lui procure des revenus lui permettant de contribuer aux charges familiales. Son désir est d'avoir une boutique pour exposer ses marchandises et assurer le bien - être de la famille.( Âgée de 36ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant de 09ans scolarisé)
texts.en: With this fourth loan requested from WAGES, Kokoé will buy kitchenware. She has been in this business since 1998 and it allows her to contribute to her family's expenses. Her wish is to have her own store to show her goods and ensure the well-being of her family. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of a nine-year-old schoolchild.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware.

loans.name: Las Fresitas Group

texts.es:
Las Fresitas es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 5 mujeres alegres y emprendedoras, ellas se unieron para formar dicho grupo ya que son de la misma comunidad y se dedican al comercio. 
Ema es uno de los integrantes de este grupo tiene 54 años, esta casada con Óscar quien trabaja como chofer, ella platica que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos y tacos en un local que tiene frente a su casa la cual se ubica a orilla de la carretera federal y sus principales clientes son los viajeros, sus ventas las realiza todos los días por las noches, y lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que ha tenido la 
oportunidad de conocer a muchas personas y que trabaja haciendo lo que más le gusta: cocinar.
Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudará a compra  chiles, tomates, cebolla, carne, aguacates, papas,  platanos, tortillas, crema, queso, frijol, masa.

Ella espera que su negocio continúe creciendo para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Las demás integrantes del grupo son:
María Virginia venta de ropa y calzado
Laura cría de cerdos y ganado
Brenda venta de tacos 
Perla tienda de abarrotes
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Fresitas” and is made up of five happy and enterprising ladies.  They got together to form this group, since they are from the same community and all are merchants.

Ema is one of the members and she is 54 years old.  She’s married to Oscar, who works as a driver and she says that she has been selling Mexican food and tacos, in front of her home, which is located alongside the federal highway, for the past five years.  Her main customers are the travelers and she makes her sales day and night.  What she enjoys the most is that she has had the opportunity to meet many people and work on something she likes to do; cook. 

A loan through Kiva and Vision Fund  will help her buy peppers, tomatoes, onions, meat, avocados, potatoes, plantains, tortillas, cream, cheese, beans, and dough. 

She expects her business to continue to grow so she can have a better quality of life.

The other members are:

María Virginia sells clothing and shoes
Laura raises pigs and livestock
Brenda sells tacos
Perla has a grocery store

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Marcela Del Pilar

texts.es:
Marcela del Pilar tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra de abarrotes menestras, leche, aceite y arroz, también ofrece a la venta de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropa de temporada primavera – verano, para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela del Pilar is 52 years old and lives with her husband in the Buenos Aires district, where its residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from the city of Piura, along the northern coast of Peru.

She sells groceries such as milk, cooking oil, and rice.  She also sells children’s, ladies’ and men’s clothing out of her store, located within her home.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 New Soles so she can buy seasonal spring and summer clothing to offer her customers and be able to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is a 24-year-old from the Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  In 2010, Ramatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to develop herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a poor network within her operation area.

Ramatu require a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Ramatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Daima is a group of six farmers in the Matete District. Julia has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 51 other individual farmers represented by this group.  The supplies provided consist of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 KES.							

Julia is married and has eight children.  She is 48 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, and trustworthy.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group. Julia has been a farmer for 10 years.  She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

The 2013 rainy season won’t be Julia’s first season with One Acre Fund. She first joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with them in order to obtain new farming methods, fertilizer, and hybrid seeds to earn enough to feed her family.  As an active member in her community, Julia also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader and being active in community activities.  Julia plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she was able to save money and feed her family.							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with small farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Julia and the Daima Group will use the Kiva loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							


The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left side.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizers for growing maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Adama from Waterloo2, eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with five children. She began her business because she wanted to improve her status of living. In 2007, Adama established her retail business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her is the difficulty of transporting the scrap.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more scrap metal for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Adama plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metal for resale.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Memunatu from Waterloo, eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with four children. She started the business to take care of her family. 

Memunatu runs a fish business at home. She sells fish within her community. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Memunatu says that the main challenges to her business are the price of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Memunatu has requested a loan in order to buy more fish for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Segundo Andres

texts.es:
Segundo Andrés tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, cultivo de frutales y comercio de los mismos, ganadería ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra panetones, chocolate de taza, champagne, vinos y dulces para abastecer su negocio y asi generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Andrés, age 56, lives with his wife in the Pucará district.  This community is known for it warm climate, for growing and selling fruits, and for its livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Jaén in the northern highlands of Peru.

He sells groceries, rice, cooking oil, sugar, and milk.  His business is located in his house.  He has requested a loan for 4,500 soles to buy sweet breads, bars of chocolate used to make hot chocolate, champaign, wine, and sweets to stock his business.  This way he will generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season to stock his business.

loans.name: Presiñano

texts.es:
Presiñano tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta y crianza de animales menores patos, cuyes y pavos, en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales ya si tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Presiñano, 55, lives with his wife in the Cayaltí district, located two hours from the city of Piura on Peru's north coast. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise livestock. Presiñano raises and sells small animals like ducks, guinea pigs, and turkeys in his backyard. He has applied for a loan of 800 nuevos soles to buy feed to fatten his animals so that he has more stock to sell to customers and can earn more for his family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Nelly Auria

texts.es:
Nelly Aurora tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad donde la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes aceite, arroz, leche, azúcar, menestras, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, tiene clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly Aurora, age 58, lives with her family in the Oyotún district.  The population in this community works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells groceries, cooking oil, rice, milk, sugar, and vegetables.  Her business is located in her home.  She has considerable clientele.  

She has requested a loan for 1,000 soles to buy merchandise to stock her business.  This way she will generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 23-year-old Abibatu from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. Single with one child, she started her business to take care of her family. 

Since 2008, Abibatu has been running a green vegetable business at home, selling cassava leaves within her community. Working from morning until night throughout the week, Abibatu says that her main challenges are transportation costs and insufficient funds to expand.

Abibatu has requested a loan in order to buy more vegetables for resale. The extra income arising from this loan will enable her to educate her child and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es:
Julieth, a sus 30 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una venta de café y aromáticas de manera ambulante, actividad que aprendió con una amiga que realiza la misma labor. Inicialmente compraba el café preparado y lo revendía, pero luego aprendió a prepararlo ella misma, así pudo generar mayor rentabilidad, permitiéndole generar un empleo directo; de manera alterna y, para complementar sus ingresos también vende mercancía como ropa y perfumería; trabaja todos los días de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm y de esta forma logra percibir los recursos necesarios para aportar a la economía de la familia, que está conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Con el interés de seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, solicita su apoyo, pues el dinero del crédito será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (azúcar, café, artículos desechables) y mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, perfumes, entre otros), así tendrá disponibilidad de materia prima y de mercancía para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de fin de año; dando como resultado, un incremento favorable en la entrada de dinero para su familia.
Julieth tiene como propósito principal adquirir un local más amplio para tener la oportunidad de diversificar el inventario con nuevos productos y así prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes. De esta forma podrá brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julieth, age 30, works in her own business.  She sells coffee and spices in an itinerant manner.  She learned this business activity with a friend who does the same work.  Initially, she bought the coffee prepared, and she resold it.  Then, she learned how to prepare it herself.  This way she was able to generate more profitability, which is allowing her to generate direct employment.  

In order to complement her income, she also sells merchandise like clothes and perfume.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  This way she manages to get the resources needed to contribute to the family finances.  Her family is comprised of her husband and their two children.

In order to continue strengthening her business, she is requesting help.  She will use the loan to buy supplies wholesale (sugar, coffee, disposable products) and wholesale merchandise (blouses, jeans, and perfumes, among others).  This way she will have raw material available and merchandise to satisfy the demand that increases during the end of the year season.  This will result in a favorable increase in the incoming money for her family.

Julieth’s main objective is to get a bigger place in order to have the opportunity to diversify her inventory with new products.  This way she will provide a more complete service to her customers.  This way she will be able to give her family a better sense of well-being and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (sugar, coffee, disposable products) and wholesale merchandise (blouses, jeans, and perfumes, among others).

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 27-year-old from the Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with one child.  In 2008, Kadiatu established her plastic rubber business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the business main challenge is insufficient capital to expand.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic rubber to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic rubber to expand her business.

loans.name: Rianatou

texts.fr:
Rianatou est une jeune femme de 30 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants de 3 et 8 ans. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 2 ans déjà, elle fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille. 
   
 

Photo ( Modifier )
texts.en: Rianatou is a 30-year old woman, married and the mother of three children ranging from three to eight years of age. After completing her training, she opened a small sewing shop, which has been going well for two years already. She also does embroidery but does not have sufficient materials in order to complete her orders more quickly and meet the customer demand in time. This is why she is looking for a loan to buy fabcrics and sewing accessories (pins, needles, lining thread etc), which will save her the trouble of constantly going to the market. She would then be able to contuing sewing and selling the products to her customers. The revenue derived from this loan will allow her not only to buy some sewing materials to expand her business but also provide for some of her personal needs as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Omer

texts.en:
Omer is 27 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a hard-working and very honorable man, always committed to getting ahead.

All his life he has been working hard and earning money to assist his family. He is a kind man who owns a taxi that getting a low daily income. His income is not enough to cover household expenses. Recently, his taxi is not working well so he is requesting a loan from AMB to buy spare parts to repair his taxi. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Gwitembe B Group

texts.en:
Gwitembe B is a Nuru International group of four farmers based within the Kuria West district. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Johnes has been a member of the group for three years. He is 53 years old and is married with three children. He lives with his wife and children. Johnes has been able to learn better farming methods through his group but financial constraints limit him from implementing what he has learned. He is therefore requesting for a loan from Kiva to enable him to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer. 

During the coming season, Johnes will plant ½ acre of maize and ¼ each of sorghum and millet. The produce he will get from his one acre farm will sustain his family with food. He plans to sell the surplus and invest in a small business that will supplement his income for other domestic uses.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Olga Regina

texts.es:
Olga es madre soltera de un hijo de 19 años de edad, al que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Hace más de 13 años se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una charcutería en la que ofrece mecato, gaseosas, cerveza y licor; trabaja todos los días de 12 pm a 12 am, cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada para los fines de semana, días en los que se incrementan las ventas; así logra generar los recursos suficientes para dar a su hijo una buena educación y sustento diario.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su inventario, solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (cervezas, licores, gaseosas, mecato, entre otros), esto le permitirá satisfacer la demanda actual y mejorar las ventas.
Olga tiene como propósito a mediano plazo, adquirir un local propio en el que pueda montar su negocio y así mejorar la rentabilidad del mismo, ahorrándose el dinero de arriendo que paga actualmente para dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Olga is the single mother of her 19 year old son.  She has gotten him ahead with a lot of effort and dedication.  She has been tending to her own business for over 13 years.  Her business is a deli where she offers snacks, soft drinks, beer, and liquor.  She works every day from 12:00 p.m. until 12:00 a.m.  She has help from an employee on the week-ends.  Those are the days when sales increase.  This way she generates sufficient resources to give her son a good education and daily support.

In order to strengthen her inventory, she is requesting the loan to buy stock wholesale (beer, liquor, soft drinks, and snacks, among others).  This will allow her to satisfy the current demand and improve sales.

Olga’s mid-range objective is to get her own space in which she would be able to establish her business.  This way the business would be more profitable.  She would be saving the rent money that she currently pays in order to give her son a better quality of life and improve his well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (beer, liquor, soft drinks, and snacks, among others).

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu. She is 35 years old from Waterloo2, western rural area in Freetown. She is married with five children. In 2012, Kadiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to develop herself. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometime the vehicle breaks down on the way.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en:
Meet Hassanatu; she is 22 years old and from Waterloo2 Eastern Area in Freetown. She is married with two children. 

In 2009, Hassanatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation from her operation area.

Hassanatu requires a loan in order to purchase more equipment to expand her stove business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. 

In the future, Hassanatu plans to open a provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to expand her stove business

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Meet Mamusu. She is 37 years old and from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 5 children.  In 2010, Mamusu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business 7 days per week, 12 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Mamusu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Mamusu plans to open a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Otari

texts.en:
Otari is a 56-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and son in a small village of the Sachkhere district. His wife is a housekeeper and his son goes to the local school. Otari works on a minibus line and gets a small monthly income. 

Otari decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL to begin a trading business. He will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then transport them with his minibus to different villages and will resell them with a price markup. This will increase the income of his family and with increased income he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock and begin trade with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Cleofer

texts.es:
Cleofer tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, desde hace más de diez años su mercadería lo distribuye por los alrededores de los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de diversos tipos de pescado para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Cleofer, 55, lives with his son in Nueva Arica district, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise livestock. Cleofer has been selling seafood for more that 10 years in nearby smalls towns. He has applied for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy various kinds of seafood to sell to his customers so that he can earn more for his family.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of seafood.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garmik is from Gyumri. He lives with his father, brother and wife. For 3 years, Garnik has been providing vehicle repair service. He renovates and paints the cars and gathers income which is vital for his family's living. 

Garnik currently faces financial difficulties. He is unable to purchase tools and material needed for his work. This is the reason why Garnik has applied for this loan. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Garnik to purchase sprays and materials to be able to provide vehicle repair service.

loans.use: to pay for sprays and materials for providing vehicle repair service.

loans.name: Marie     T

texts.en:
Meet Marie. She is 20 years old and from Waterloo2 in the Western Area Rural District. She is single with 1 child.  In 2011, Marie established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to develop herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to open a big store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy several bales of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Fredesvinda tiene 56 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y comidas que prepara ella misma y los ofrece en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de golosinas y de esta manera abastecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is 56 years old.  She lives in the Oyotún district.  The people there work in agriculture, business, and cattle ranching.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Perú.

She works selling sweets and foods that she prepares herself.  She offers them from her home.  She has asked for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles for the purchase of sweets.  In this way she can stock her business, generating a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy sweets to stock up her business.

loans.name: Fehmeda

texts.en: Fehmeda is 51 years old and works from home as a tailor. She is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Fehmeda was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family. Fehmeda felt an obligation to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. The loan will help her to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 47-year-old married woman. She has eight children, four daughters and four sons. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business stitching clothes to contribute in the family income.

She is well familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors along with packs of buttons and needles. This will enable her to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors along with packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Suryia

texts.en:
Suryia, age 50, is a married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling animals for the past five years. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, Suryia requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Shehar

texts.en: Shehar is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching clothes. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of the children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Shehar hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 36 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia, trabajan mucho para poder así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Luzmila consiste en la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, leche, papel higiénico, azúcar, entre otros. Su tienda está instalada en el frontis de su casa y es la única de su localidad por lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas y sus ganancias económicas estables. Lleva trabajando en esta activad mas de 2 años. Se inició vendiendo productos en pequeñas cantidades, ahora vende mucho más y le va muy bien, tiene la ayuda de su esposo con quien organiza su día laboral. Le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes, le agrada disponer de su tiempo ya que así puede cuidar a sus menores hijos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, azúcar, leche y huevos para que continúe vendiendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
Luzmila, age 36, is married and has two children, ages 11 and 5, respectively.  She lives in her own home.  They work a lot in order to be able to give a better quality of life to their family.  

Luzmila’s work consists in the sale of grocery products such as rice, sugar, milk, toilet paper, and sugar, among others.  Her store is set up in the front part of her house.  It is the only one in her neighborhood, so her sales are assured and her earnings are stable.  She has been working at this job for more than two years.  She began selling products in small quantities, but now she sells a lot more and it is going really well for her.  She has the help of her husband, with whom she organizes their working day.  It is going really well for her because she has a lot of customers.  She likes to have time available so that she can take care of her younger children.  

At this opportunity, she is asking for 1,000 nuevos soles.  She is very happy to know she will have financial support, because in this way she’ll feel safer moving forward with her business.  With the requested amount, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, and eggs so that she can continue selling items in her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has three years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Sakina is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, sugar and oil to meet the increasing demands of her customers. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 31 years old and lives in Stepanavan City in the Lori region. He is married and he has two very nice daughters. 

Vardan has worked in the swine-breeding business for five years. All the skills and secrets of farming he learned from his father who was very famous and popular in pig breeding. Vardan has many piglets that demand much care and a lot of fodder. Vardan manages to sell a great deal of meat during the year, which creates good income for both his family and his farm.

During the winter months, fodder is very important for piglets. Therefore Vardan is asking for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to buy animal fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy luchadora, sobretodo porque ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos sola; para poder tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de comida como caldo de gallina, Juanes, tacacho con cecina, entre otros y gracias a ello ha podido ir mejorando cada día; Rosa tiene su negocio desde hace 1 años y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón.

Rosa gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva podrá comprar implementos para su negocio como mesas, sillas, mejorar su local, platos, vasos, entre otros y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y atender mejor a sus clientes y luchar por hacer su gran sueño:” Tener una casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very tenacious woman.  Above all, this is because she has gotten her four children ahead by herself.  In order to have income to be able to get her family ahead, she decided to start her business of selling food like chicken soup, rice and beans, "tacacho con cecina" (a typical dish with meat and bananas), and others.  Thanks to this, she has been able to improve every day.  Rosa has had her business for one year, and she believes it is going well for her because of her good seasoning.

Thanks to the support of the Kiva lenders, Rosa will be able to buy things for her business like tables and chairs.  She will be able to improve her place and buy plates and glasses, among other things.  This way she will be able to improve her income and better tend to her customers.    She will continue struggling in order to make her big dream come true.  Her dream is to have a house made of sturdy material.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es soltero, de 51 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos: 5 varones y 2 mujeres, el junto a su familia vive en Barrio San Bartolo, Sololá. Se dedica al cultivo de papa, esa actividad la heredó de sus padres, porque desde niño los ayudaba a cultivar la tierra. Realiza está actividad porque le gusta estar en contacto con la naturaleza y  además es la fuente de los ingresos que utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de semilla y fertilizante orgánico y pago de mano de obra para el cultivo de papa. 
El sueño más importante de Pedro es  que un futuro todos sus hijos sean profesionales y para ello los apoya en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Pedro is single.  He is 51 years old and has seven children: five boys and two girls.  He lives, together with his family, in Barrio San Bartolo, Sololá.  He works farming potatoes.  He inherited this work from his parents, because from his childhood, he helped them to farm the land.  He does this work because he likes to be in touch with nature and besides, it is the source of income that he uses to take care of his family.

He is asking for a loan of 6,000 quetzales for the purchase of seed and organic fertilizer, and to pay for labor for the potato crop.

Pedro’s most important dream is that, in the future, all his children could be professionals, and that he could support them in their studies.

loans.use: to buy seed and organic fertilizer, and to pay for labor for the potato crop

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 36-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her house. She has four years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market since he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Riffat is a mother of two children and she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

Riffat wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, grains, and beverages, to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, grains, and beverages.

loans.name: Dúo San Miguel Group

texts.es: El dúo San Miguel esta formado por doña MERVELIN MARICELA de 28 años, tiene 2 hijas (una de 8 Y 12 años) que estudian, ella tiene un local ubicado cerca de la plazuela ciudad vieja, en su negocio tiene una gran variedad de mercadería para la venta (piñatas, dulces, regalos, ropa de dama, niño, niña, ropa interior, bolsas etc.) ya que es la única que vende piñatas y dulces cerca del área donde vive, ella solicita su crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa ya que se acerca la feria titular de su comunidad y tiene mucha demanda en ropa  de vestir y ella desea aprovechar la ocasión para invertir mas, sus sueño es poder ahorrar para comprar un terreno y poder construir una casa para darle a sus hijas donde vivir mas adelante.
texts.en:
The San Miguel partnership is made up of doña Mervelin Maricela, age 28. She has two daughters (one of them eight years old and one of them twelve) who are students.  

She has a shop located near the old city square.  She has a wide variety of merchandise for sale in her business (piñatas; sweets; gifts; clothing for ladies, boys, and girls; underwear; bags; etc.) Hers is the only store that sells piñatas and sweets near the area where she lives.  She is asking for her loan to invest in the purchase of clothing, because her community’s festival is coming up and there is a high demand for dressy clothes.  She wants to take advantage of the occasion to invest more.  

Her dream is to be able to save to buy a plot of land and be able to build a house to give her daughters a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Robert Nicolas

texts.es:
Robert es un joven de 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial y es un joven muy carismático y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Dia a día Robert trabaja como ayudante de construcción y como pintor de casas culminadas, con el fruto de su trabajo solventa con esfuerzo sus gastos estudiantiles ya que él se encuentra cursando la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma, Robert trabaja alrededor de 9 horas y por las tardes acude a su centro de estudios, Robert cree que está saliendo adelante porque se esfuerza mucho y sobre todo es muy responsable.

Robert está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias  es la segunda vez que le brindan su apoyo; el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder cercar la parte trasera d esu vivienda ya que se encuentra desprotegida y no tiene mucha seguridad de esta manera Robert podrá colaborar con el bienestar de su familia y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Robert is a young man, age 26.  He lives in the city of Imperial.  He is a very charismatic guy with a strong desire to get ahead above all else.  Everyday Robert works as a construction assistant and as a house painter.  Using his earnings, he covers his student expenses with great effort, because he is currently studying Agricultural Engineering.  Robert works about nine hours, and in the afternoons attends his school.  Robert believes that he is getting ahead because he works hard and, above all, is very responsible.

Robert is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because, thankfully, this is the second time that they have given him support.  He will be able to buy construction materials to be able to enclose the rear of his property with a fence because currently it is unprotected and isn’t very safe.  In this way, Robert will be able to contribute to the well-being of his family and keep fighting each day to be able to make his biggest dream come true: to finish his Agricultural Engineering degree and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to build a security fence.

loans.name: Heric Hernany

texts.es:
Heric, se encuentra descapitalizado por lo que ha optado por un nuevo crédito y con el que invertirá en la compra de maíz, elotes, aceite, leña y otros, que le servirán para seguir trabajando en su negocio de elaboración de tamales y tener satisfechos a sus clientes.
Con el capital anterior el compro lo necesario para elaborar sus productos, su negocio se amplió y le genero los ingresos con los cuales cancelo sus cuotas del préstamo y le cambio el estilo de vida a su familia. Su  familia se encuentra muy bien de salud.
texts.en:
Heric has found himself without capital for his business, which is why he has opted for a new loan. With it he will invest in corn, corn on the cob, oil, firewood and other materials which will allow him to keep working in his business of making tamales and keep his customers satisfied. 

With the previous loan he bought what was necessary to make his products. His business grew and he generated income, with which he repaid his loan and changed his family's way of life. His family is in very good health.

loans.use: to buy corn, corn on the cob, oil, firewood and other materials.

loans.name: Alex's Group

texts.en:
Alex is a member of Bakhana Group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of 10 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo. The group leaders represent a total of 99 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Alex has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right, with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 (shillings) for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Alex is married and has no children. He is 43 years old and is known as friendly, hard-working, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group,  prayer group, and burial committee. Alex has been a farmer for ten years.  Alex described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year, by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Alex first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Alex joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family, and send children to school.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and an active community member. He wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. 

Alex plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Alex’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training,  has more farm group support and he was able to save money. 
 							
Alex and the Bakhana Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Abel's Group

texts.en:
Abel is a member of Makhese S.H.G Group in Webuye District.  He is pictured here in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 21 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Abel has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 (shillings) for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
